info.game_comments:
2005 Ultimate Tournament of Champions Round 1, game 24.

(Sarah: Ice and snow keep some people outdoors!  Clues about all kinds of winter sports, next on Jeopardy!)

(1, 1).clue: In 1770 Adams defended Capt. Thomas Preston & 6 others against murder charges for their part in this March 5 "riot"

(2, 1).clue: People of this national ancestry form the majority, 67%, of the USA's Hispanic minority

(3, 1).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reads from a speed skating rink in Park City, UT.)  It's the geometric name for a speed skating track; high altitude helps make the Utah Olympic one here the fastest ice on Earth

(4, 1).clue: This brown tint originally from a sea creature is used in photography

(5, 1).clue: Because '60s boys didn't play with dolls, Hasbro coined this 2-word term to describe Joe

(6, 1).clue: It's the hairy humanoid aka Sasquatch

(1, 2).clue: Adams called it "the most insignificant office that ever the invention of man contrived"

(2, 2).clue: Filipino Muslims are called Moros, the Spanish form of this English word

(3, 2).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reads from Park City, UT.)  Kufens, which steer the luge, are attached to these, also called steels

(4, 2).clue: An apple pie recipe in "Joy of Cooking" calls for 1/2 teaspoon of this ground spice

(5, 2).clue: 1967's female G.I. Jo(e), now worth thousands in mint condition, wasn't a warrior but had this caring job

(6, 2).clue: In this sweet mountain of song, hobos will find "a land that's fair and bright"

(1, 3).clue: As president, Adams retained this man, Washington's Secretary of War; a Baltimore fort was later named for him

(2, 3).clue: Initially, Spanish officials said that a group representing this minority did the 2004 train bombings

(3, 3).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew lies prone with a rifle on a range in Park City, UT.)  To be steady enough to fire accurately, a biathlete has to quickly bring this down from the 200s to the 160s

(4, 3).clue: A beard & a shade of brown are both named this, after a Flemish painter

(5, 3).clue: The original 11-1/2" long Joe began a long hiatus (or was he undercover?) the year after this real conflict ended

(6, 3).clue: A large wild sheep of North America

(1, 4).clue: John Adams belonged to this party that favored a strong central government

(2, 4).clue: Arabs make up 20% of this country; they vote, serve in the army & are represented in Parliament by the United Arab List

(3, 4).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew narrates a game being played on a rink in Park City, UT.)   As well as speeding up the stone by reducing friction, sweeping reduces side-to-side movement, which logically is called this

(4, 4).clue: A potato & a winter apple with a rough brownish skin have this brown name

(5, 4).clue: In the '80s this pro wrestler with a rank in his name became the first real person to join the G.I. Joe corps

(6, 4).clue: Technically, this digit is the hallux

(1, 5).clue: This diplomatic "affair" led Americans to cry, "Millions for defense... but not one cent for tribute"

(2, 5).clue: They're the largest minority group in Kyrgyzstan

(3, 5).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew crouches as he skis down a slope in Park City, UT.)  Aerodynamically, this is the best position for shushing, or speeding straight down the hill

(4, 5).clue: Astronomers know that the name of this brown comes from the Latin for "shadow"

(5, 5).clue: In the '70s Joe took up martial arts & learned this "grip"

(6, 5).clue: Nick goes fishing in this 2-part story from Hemingway's "In Our Time"

(1, 1).clue: Each of his "Four Seasons" is accompanied by a poem that he wrote

(3, 1).clue: "Heaven truly knows that thou are as false as hell", said Othello of this character; he later took it back

(4, 1).clue: Ascomycetes, the largest class in this kingdom, includes edible types like truffles

(5, 1).clue: It's the suspension of a defendant's sentence, granting him provisional freedom on the promise of good behavior

(6, 1).clue: Film in which Richard Clemenza explains to James Caan the "Sicilian message" of a bulletproof vest & a fish

(1, 2).clue: At 25 he wrote his symphony in B minor consisting of 2 completed movements, an unfinished third & no fourth

(2, 2).clue: Pinchas Zukerman & Dudley Moore both married this cinematic sex kitten

(3, 2).clue: "All that is within him does condemn itself for being there", said Menteith of the title character in this tragedy

(4, 2).clue: C4 plants, which photosynthesize molecules having 1 more of these atoms than C3 plants, do better if it's hot & dry

(5, 2).clue: This drug was the first selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor approved in the U.S.

(6, 2).clue: After being raised at the North Pole, Will Ferrell finds out that his real dad is James Caan in this holiday film

(1, 3).clue: His most famous work, "Finlandia", was first performed in 1899

(2, 3).clue: This restaurant chain began in 1965 with a NYC site at First & 63rd

(3, 3).clue: In this comedy Jaques says to Orlando in the Forest of Arden, "Let's meet as little as we can"

(4, 3).clue: Familial name for the 2 new cells resulting from cell division

(5, 3).clue: It's the long flexible snout of some mammals like the tapir

(6, 3).clue: This quirky 1992 comedy featured Caan as gangster Tommy Korman, who lost the girl to one of the Flying Elvises

(1, 4).clue: In 1988, more than 40 years after his death, his remains were moved from New York to Budapest for a state funeral

(3, 4).clue: Play in which Thersites tells Ajax, "The plague of Greece upon thee, thou mongrel beef-witted lord!"

(4, 4).clue: Term for determining the order of nucleotides in a DNA molecule

(5, 4).clue: In anatomy, it's a muscle that draws a part forward; in math, it's a device for measuring angles

(6, 4).clue: In a classic 1970 TV movie, Caan portrayed this real-life cancer-stricken athlete

(1, 5).clue: Featured in "Somewhere in Time", his beautiful "Rhapsody on a Theme of Paganini" is heard here

(2, 5).clue: It's estimated 100 million people attended his early 20th century religious revivals

(3, 5).clue: The shepherd says "His garments are rich but he wears them not handsomely" of Autolychus in this romance

(4, 5).clue: Excess or deficiency of this pituitary hormone leads to gigantism or dwarfism

(5, 5).clue: This colorless flammable gas is the third member of the paraffin series, following methane & ethane

(6, 5).clue: Caan welcomes future son-in-law Hugh Grant to "The Family" in this 1999 mob comedy

(0, 0).clue: To allow people to communicate more quickly, on May 15, 1918, courtesy of the U.S. Army, this service began
